title: India gains independence
description: The Dominion of India gained independence from the United Kingdom.

title: Republic Day of India
description: The Constitution of India came into effect; India became a republic.

title: Apollo 11 Moon Landing
description: Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin landed on the Moon; 'one small step' historic moment.

title: Start of World War I
description: World War I began after the Austro-Hungarian declaration of war on Serbia.

title: End of World War II
description: Formal surrender of Japan marked the end of World War II.

title: Albert Einstein born
description: Physicist Albert Einstein, developer of the theory of relativity, was born.

title: Assassination of Mahatma Gandhi
description: Mahatma Gandhi was assassinated in New Delhi.

title: Fall of the Berlin Wall
description: The Berlin Wall fell, symbolizing the end of the Cold War era divide in Germany.

title: Wright brothers' first flight
description: Orville and Wilbur Wright made the first successful powered airplane flight.

title: Nelson Mandela born
description: Nelson Rolihlahla Mandela, anti-apartheid revolutionary and later President of South Africa, was born.

title: Martin Luther King Jr. born
description: Civil rights leader Martin Luther King Jr. was born.

title: Indian Ocean Earthquake and Tsunami
description: A massive undersea earthquake triggered a series of tsunamis affecting many countries.

title: Pokhran-II nuclear tests
description: India conducted a series of nuclear tests in Pokhran.
